page.title: 17W/C(ADMIN) R.A.F. WADDINGTON
page.content: The Wing Commander rises at 6.45am and after washing has a breakfast of coffee, grapefruit, scrambled-eggs, sausage, marmalade on toast and more coffee. He drives to work and arrives in the office around 8.00am. The Wing Commander's first job is to read all the signals that have come in over the night and then he answers the morning letters. Around 10.00am there is usually a meeting. For instance an inspection might be planned. Lunchtime should be 90 minutes but the Wing Commander takes only half an hour. The afternoon is usually spent writing letters and talking on the telephone. Around 6.00pm the Wing Commander takes a jog around the sports field and then eats in the officers' mess. Then it is back to the office for more desk work before having a shower and retiring to bed at 10.30pm.
